Term.Name: Package
Term.Definition: A coherent / related group of programmes grouped for delivery, release or else.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Collection
Term.Definition: A group of programmes / resources, themed or not themed.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Series
Term.Definition: an ordered or unordered collection of programmes that is shown in a sequence (e.g. "Friends" season 1, episodes "1 to n"). An unbounded series (e.g. an ongoing drama series) may be considered to be a serial.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Show
Term.Definition: a programme theme that is typically be associated with a collection of series (e.g. all episodes of Friends). programConcept - the editorial concept for a programme from which specific programme versions have been derived (e.g. the concept of "Blood Runner" as opposed to "Blood Runner - The Director's Cut" as a specific version of that concept).
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Concept
Term.Definition: An editorially coherent groups of programmes
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Compilation
Term.Definition: a collection of programmes that is used to allow segments from multiple programmes to be combined in segment groups. When used in conjunction with segmentation information, a programCompilation programme group allows, for example, several related news segments from different news programmes to be grouped for playback in sequence.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Choice
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Highlights
Term.Definition: A selection of most representative resources.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Sub-series
Term.Definition: A sub-grouping of episodes beneath the level of the series.

Term.Name: Season
Term.Definition: Collection of programmes with an overarching editorial theme (e.g. "Renaissance Art"). Not to be confused with series.

Term.Name: Magazine
Term.Definition: A collection of individual programmes that are shown as a group because they are editorially coherent (e.g. a general sports programme with individual sub-programmes covering different events)

Term.Name: Mini-series
Term.Definition: A series consisting of a limited number of programmes (typically 2 or 3) screened over a short period of time (e.g. on consecutive days); these may be based on a literary work or have some other theme where it is important that all of the programmes be viewed and that they be viewed in sequence.

Term.Name: Brand
Term.Definition: An overarching group representing a marketing brand. Such a group may contain groups of any other type or programmes that share the same branding, for example a show and its spin-off series. All members should be acquired if the group is selected.

Term.Name: Automatic Acquisition Themed
Term.Definition: A collection of events related by some editorial policy that shall be acquired automatically. All members of the group should be acquired.

Term.Name: Automatic Acquisition Non Themed
Term.Definition: A collection of events that are not editorially related which shall be acquired automatically. All members of the group should be acquired.

Term.Name: Clip
Term.Definition: the editorial concept of a piece of short-form content, excerpted from a longer episode, from which specific clip versions have been derived.

Term.Name: Other relation
Term.Definition: Can be used for any other grouping of content not represented in the list above and from where only one member of the group should be acquired is the group is selected.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
